poem:
Title: "The Replay Stage"

Sitcoms strut from screen to stage,
Like figures skipping from historic page.
Nostalgia is the laugh we chase,
Threading the needle of time and place.
Ghosts of laughter past reprised,
In theatres, their spectres baptized.
Old sitcoms in new light unfurled,
A timeless joke retold in this ever-changing world. 
Come partake, as memories are theatrically twirled.
